caption: This place is a (sort of) hidden gem. The first time we went, we showed up without a reservation, hoping to snag a table. The hostess was super friendly about it and made sure we were able to order a drink while we waited. We then had a mind blowing meal with the best service I think I have ever experienced. They have half-cocktails, which are excellent if you want to try more than one thing. The best one we tried was a dry bubbly cocktail that came with a rosemary spring. So tasty without being too sweet or too boozy. Our server gave us great recommendations--I think I had the halibut and my partner had a steak. Perfection!

I have been to Pammy's twice and will return again. Overall, it is very good, both for service and food. The chicken and the octopus, in particular, stand out. My only complaint is the wine list. It is challenging and too intellectually "cute." If you want a glass of a rhone, a white Burgundy, or cabernet sauvignon, you won't find it.

Well, it’s safe to say that Pammy’s is my favorite restaurant in the greater Boston area and Cambridge. The atmosphere, the staff, and the flavor palette and curation of the dishes will put you in a dream. Pammy herself, who if you’re lucky enough, will meet you at the door with her gorgeous charm and warm heart. Absolutely radiating, and a true gem of a restaurant that Cambridge is honored to house.

5 stars for ambience and service. Minimal but artsy interiors. Cocktails were also on point. But I cannot lie about the food , at least about my experience. Most of the food was really salty, don't know if it was a one off incident or if that's a common issue. I have had real italian food at less fancy places and they have been amazing. But at pammy's, food was good but forgettable. But does that mean I won't go back? No, I definitely want to go back and give it more chances.  Give it a chance and you might just end up loving the experience.
Their craft cocktails are the absolute best!! Their steak is also awesome
You serious Clark

I have been to Pammy's twice and will return again. Overall, it is very good, both for service and food. The chicken and the octopus, in particular, stand out. My only complaint is the wine list. It is challenging and too intellectually "cute." If you want a glass of a rhone, a white Burgundy, or cabernet sauvignon, you won't find it.
The starter we ordered, lamb belly piadina, was amazing! Special pasta is also very special! Super friendly and cozy dining experience!
Probably one of the best restaurants in Boston. Also pricey, but it is worth it.
Holy cow. Evey flavor is explosive and delicious. Breakfast or lunch, I've not been disappointed. Super friendly staff, convenient order ahead and drive through. Pammy's place is doing it right.
One of the best restaurants I’ve been to in Boston / Cambridge since moving back. Super interesting menu whilst also being accessible. Keep up the great work!
Certainly a spot worth stopping by, the food is great and fresh, the pricing is convenient and it is constantly well kept there. Keep up the good work.

All I can say is YUM! This is for a takeout pick-up order we did last weekend. The bolo kit was so delish, and an excellent value. Just the right amount of zip so you kept wanting more! Plan to come back soon to get some extra sauce kits to give a gifts to friends. Wintery cocktails to go were spot-on. Thanks Pammy's team!
This spot is great! Affordable pricing, big dishes and the staff members are constantly very nice.

The cocktails here are delicious and they are constantly mixing it up. For dinner I would say focus on the pasta - the lumache is a MUST HAVE dish that my fiance and I make sure to get every time we come. The flavors in all the dishes are outstanding. By far one of my favorite spots in Cambridge.
I recommend their drink called 'Avivador'. It is divine!

This isn't a place you go when you want a cheap meal to eat over your coffee table with Netflix in the background asking if you're still watching Tiger King. This is a place you go to dress up like an adult and have a nice dinner. It isn't cheap for sure, but the price is worth it. If Michelin gave out stars in Boston, this place would be a contender for one. The service was great (Rob was awesome and had great drink pairings for our meal as well as crazy knowledge of all things cocktails) and we barely noticed the covid restrictions as we had, for the first time in many months, a high class meal. Highly recommend asking for vegetarian options, the veggie bruschetta was amazing.

If Michelin came to Massachusetts, I firmly believe Pammy's would earn a star. My experience with the octopus and duck hearts was well worth the money; cooked to the correct texture, flavored to bring out the most of the ingredients.  The cocktails offered to my wife and I by Rob Ficks were superb and his candor helped create a light atmosphere and make the night more enjoyable.  It was worth coming to and I will be returning.

Go to Pammys and most DEFINITELY get the Chef's Menu with the wine pairings. And honestly, why stop there; get dessert and roll yourself on out, lol. Michelle was stellar, and Pammy, per usual, was warm and fashionable. And always get the Lumache. ALWAYS.

I arrive at this marvelous  restaurant many times  as I enjoy the ambiance that is unique to this place. The crew is extremely attentive and qualified. The service is deeply fast. Needless to say, the food they cook is perfect. I have been there more than once and I was never disappointed. The cost is honest. I suggest this place to to everybody.

I have given 3 stars because the service was outstanding and the place was very cute and cozy. Other than that the food was extremely expensive for what you get. We were a table of four and our bill was $410 for dinner, dessert and 3 drinks. There is a set price per person ($69) and you get to order 3 things from the menu, dessert not included and if you want a specialty meat or lobster dish you have to add $15 to the already fixed price. On top of that they add 6% to your bill! 3% covid recovery fee and 3% kitchen admin fee. The price would have been okay if the food was impressive but I was a little bit disappointed specially with the salad and popcorn on top. Desserts were also not good on the new menu. We ordered the sorbets and the chocolate  mousse and they were just okay.

Lovely interior and generally good taste however portion size to expectations leaves much to be desired. You choose 3 dishes per person for the fixed price. All 3 dishes will be essentially small appetizers (very small). Between each dish you will wait. So it becomes a drawn out app event when you expected dinner. Has potential but I can't give this a higher rating given this is out of line with other high end neighboring restaurants

Lovely decor, great service and pretty good food. Currently, they have a $69 pre-fix meal. Whatever you choose you will feel full by the 3rd course :) Downside: 1) the pasta dish, though tasty, was incredibly salty - possibly d/t the bread crumbs; 2) there was a $15 up charge for the lobster dish. For an impromptu dinner, it was pretty satisfying.
Awesome and yummy food, I like the atmosphere the spot has, and the employees were super friendly. I will surely visit here next time.
Consistently innovative, delicious and friendly. Fantastic wine.
My favorite restaurant in Boston, hands down. Food is excellent every time. Vibe is cozy and comfortable.
Awesome and yummy food, I like the atmosphere the spot has, and the employees were super friendly. I will surely visit here next time.
Clear, hospitality, tasty, great cocktails

The atmosphere when they were open for dine-in pre-COVID was lovely, warm, and cozy. I have come twice during COVID to order take out and the dishes I ordered were all exceptional (lumache bolognese, kale salad, and calamari on one visit and then the eggplant parm with toasted garlic bread and spaghetti on my 2nd takeout visit).
The definition of hospitality. ❤️
Inventive modern Italian with creative flavors and a fun atmosphere. Friendly service and exceptional variety of drinks.
A great place for special occasions
Great space. Amazing food. Attentive and friendly staff.
They have great food and cocktails here. Would recommend!

Service was superb and food started out terrific and ended being just ok. Most dishes were great it’s just a couple seemed to have one ingredient that didn’t necessarily need to be there or masked the flavor. Also extremely expensive but well deserved, aesthetics were pleasing and so on. Not my favorite but definitely worth another try
Food was amazing. Best Octopus I've had so far!
Place is great 👍
Lovely ambience with the best service... delectable cuisine...
Way too salty, good atmosphere though
Innovative, tasty food. Very pleasant space and friendly service. Highly recommended.
Red Snapper was particularly excellent.  Staff was friendly and awesome.
Really interesting flavor combinations. Not afraid of trying new, exciting things. Great ambiance in a casual, yet refined environment.
Lumache and steak and dessert. Do it
Pammy's always surprise my tastebud. I love to go there once in a while and try a few new things each time I go. But for me the food can be too creative to have frequently

My new favorite restaurant in Harvard Square area. We visited this spot for our anniversary and could not be more happy with our choice.  We started with ‘apertivis’ - which were pre- dinner cocktails. We then had the cheese board & foie gras. We visited Paris just a few weeks ago and I have to say their foie gras was better than anything we had there. The cheese board was pretty large and should be split by more than 2 people. My wife got the bolognese which we would both recommend. I got the tagliatelle with oxtail which was ok. We could have definitely split 1 pasta.  This place is a must visit if you are in the area.

Place was pretty good considering it was late night. We went there to eat after having a few drinks at a local bar. The bbq pork was very flavorful, chicken wings was fried perfectly crispy. Good for a quick bite on the go!Been going to this place for 18 years for Chinese food. Favorite place to get Crab Rangoon and late night meals..
The best of the best Pammy's
Awesome! We had the burrata, and the venison and the branzino. Fabulous, creative combinations. Service was outstanding.
Amazing neighborhood Italian food.  Their pastas do not disappoint.  Love the ambiance also!
Beautiful decor and, great pricing for food, A+ for the tasting
over prices, weird menu

Came here to meet up with a small group of friends for after-work drinks and maybe a bite or two to eat. The place wasn't too crowded for a Thursday night and the ambiance is pretty relaxed. It wasn't loud at all and I wouldn't say it was "library" levels of quiet either. Drinks were fairly priced and the staff was super attentive and on their heels throughout service.
Top notch. Great atmosphere, delicious food. Great for a date or a larger group at the community table.
Amazing menu and cocktail list, such a beautiful meal
Great service, good food, nice cocktails. A bit noisy but what can you do? Thanks!

Pammy’s is unbelievable. Super chic vibe & environment. Incredible wait staff with a wide breadth of knowledge. Phenomenal cocktails. The food is next level. I’ve never been so in love with a charcuterie board in my life & the grilled octopus is next level. The highlight was the bolognese however & it’s forever altered my perception of what a bolognese should be.

This impression is based on only one visit. It turned out that we are the last people to know Pammy's. By some miracle I scored a reservation. The place is rather modest building from the outside. I drive by every day to work and never realized that it was a restaurant (*). But the inside! lovely, intimate, atmosphere that reminded my of some New York trendy place rather than Harvard Square's dull establishments. The service is just outstanding and so is the cuisine.  * A historic note on how restaurants came by. In the 1700s there were no restaurants in Europe. People cooked for themselves, while travellers were served a pot of something by the tavern owner that they shared at a long table. That for a flat price. Some cooked hearty chicken soups. Soon they discovered the chicken soup's roborating properties and called them "restaurant", which means it "restores" your health. That was in France. The taverns started advertising on boards in front of the establishment that they offer "restaurant". There is more to the story but in short this is how the name came by. I learned this from the great Hungarian chef Jozsef Vinko.
Delicious, Low light restaurant perfect for relaxing evening

Very Loud. I know Boston is all about communal tables, but when you call and ask to reserve, a table they shouldn't seat you at the communal table without at least asking or giving you a heads up first.

Too expensive for the cramped and loud atmosphere and the uncomfortable seating.  My date and I were sat in the middle of the floor. She had to sit on a fireplace and my chair was in the middle of the floor, in the way of foot traffic. We asked to move the table out of the way of the foot traffic but were told that we couldn’t block the fireplace. Yet, 10 min later they seated someone else directly in front of the fireplace.  I wouldn’t recommend going here unless you want a casual atmosphere and have a lot of $$. The food is good though.
Loved pammys
Probably the closest I've had to an authenic Tuscan meal since I've returned from a recent trip to the Tuscany and Umbria regions in Italy.  Pammy's is fabulous! Go and enjoy!
Delicious food; good service; noisy as all get out

Came here last night with some friends in town. The ambiance is really inviting. Dimly lit, very intimate. It's not too big of a restaurant either.  We have a drink at the bar while we wait for our table and are seated next to the big windows. We also sat next to the fireplace which was broken at the time but once it was fixed, it would make it even more homey.  The three of us shared 2 appetizers (heirloom tomatoes and garlic toast, asparagus), 2 pastas (bucatini and lumache), and 1 meat (Branzino). The heirloom tomatoes were so simple but so fresh and delicious and you could smell the garlic on the toast immediately when it was placed on the table. The lumache had gochujang (Korean chili paste) in the bolognese which was different but delicious. The branzino was cooked perfectly.  The waiter also knew a lot about the Boston food scene so it was great chatting with him about it.  Wasn't the best Italian I've had in Boston but a very solid experience.
Just fantastic!

Beautiful experience on each occasion. Both times we were served by Angie, who was fantastic and had great recommendations for food and drinks.  We had the octopus special, the veal bruschetta, the lumache, the pork Milanese, and the sorbet trio. The pork was good enough to order twice. To drink, the Ichabod and the Argento. The thing that’s really surprising about Pammy’s is how consistently balanced the food and cocktails are, while packing in just the right intensity of flavor and texture.  The service is impeccable; in addition to being just available and present enough, the servers are never intrusive. The staff seem genuinely warm, personable, and knowledgeable about what they’re serving. Further, they were very helpful in locating a dropped credit card and on the way out, I saw one of the staff rush to tell a couple headed out the door that one of them had left their phone on the table.  The atmosphere and the decor are really great too. The one thing I don’t much like about Pammy’s is the entryway, as it’s easy to bump into other waiting customers, but as that’s my one nit picked, I’ll say that Pammy’s is one the best places to eat and drink that I know.
The lumache and steak dish are delicious but it seems very expensive, particularly with the drinks.

We were five of us from work and ordered 4 appetisers to share and each had main course. Octopus was out of the world! Soft but nicely crisp- never had anything like that- was it even octopus!? Salad was a bit salty but I love salt I swallowed them. We also ordered clam and corn dishes: both good. Main: two of us ordered pasta- which was good (wagyu and chantelle), 2 sea bass and porkchop. I had chantelle- probably too vinegary for my taste but pasta itself was good. Everyone else really loved their dishes.  This place is very beautiful interior and decoration of the bathroom was just ok spot - see it by yourself, I will not spoil. Everything beautiful but modern and with taste.  I would definitely come back!
Food was very good. But meal was over priced.
Best restaurant in the Boston / Cambridge area! Great ambiance, lovely staff, food that is basically art and extremely delicious. Thoroughly enjoyed my dinner here. Highly recommend.

There are many other items I'd like to try on their menu, so I'll be paying another visit soon. In particular, he lumache pasta (gochujang in bolognese sauce) sounds very weird but intriguing.The ribeye at Pammy's is hands down the best steak I've had in all of Boston. It comes topped with Swiss chard and a side of fingerling potatoes -- both likewise amazing. The dish is quite pricey at $58, but it's definitely worth it!

The only thing that prevents this from being 5 stars is the price and what you get for that cost. The restaurant itself is stunning--there's a lovely fireplace, the decoration is stellar, and the service is phenomenal. We ordered two appetizers and one entree to share and the meal ended up at $100. Granted, each of the dishes was delicious, the octopus in particular was extremely good, but I wish we got more than half a tentacle for the $20 we paid for it.
Nice place, delicious food, somewhat pricey but totally understandable
Best restaurant in the Boston area. Food is amazing,  staff is on point.
Lovely atmosphere, great food and drink. We had a lovely time.

Come here ASAP!! All the hype and praise Pammy's has received is 100% deserved. Some of the most interesting and delicious food I've had in Boston. Like many others have said; the ambience is real cute, service is great, and just make sure to have a reservation.
Great vibe, better food with interesting twists. Will be back

There was a wait as the place is on the small side and very popular. Tables were fairly tight as well, you'll feel squeezed for 2 people. Was a bit loud due to the space, had to raise my voice often. Portions were just right as I didn't leave still hungry. Would come here again but only for a special occasion.

Such a cute little place and the food was delicious! We just ordered a bunch of starters to share - not sure how often the menu changes but I highly recommend the octopus, the burrata, and the artichokes.

Outstanding meal, service, atmosphere, and wine. Everything we ordered was melt in your mouth delicious. Only constructive feedback is to add some sound absorption structures... was a little loud/tough to hear the conversation at table of 4.
Amazing food, excellent service!
Amazing
Best Italian in Boston
Service, food, environment all impeccable.
What a delicious menu with great variety and flavors! Add to that great service in a vibrant atmosphere! Excellent cocktails and wine!  Only area for improvement would be more comfortable chairs!

I've been to Pammy's twice this year and both visits were nothing short of exceptional. The menu featured on their website is outdated, but have no fear - anything you order at this restaurant will exceed any expectations you have. The first time I went I got the bucatini and the pork milanese. Both were absolutely delicious. I've been dreaming about the pork milanese for months and was looking forward to it for my most recent visit. Although it was not currently on the menu, I ordered their squid ink pasta and a special entree, which was a pork chop. Both were absolutely amazing. Not only is the food delicious here, but the service is also fantastic. From the minute you walk in until you leave, you are very well taken care of. Pammy's staff is always kind, knowledgeable, and on top of their "A game." Thanks again for a great night!
Everything was delicious, but the most surprisingly good dish was the greens starter. The service is great and friendly.
Fantastic new-Italian spot in Cambridge.  Moderate portion sizes - expect to order a starter, a pasta/entree, dessert, and wine to have a complete meal at about $70-90/pp after tax+tip.
Food was delicious, and the environment was so relaxed.
Outstanding flavors and presentation. Great service. Great ambiance.
Delicious!
Pammy's is one of my go-tos for a great dinner or just some drinks after work. The food, staff, drinks and vibe are all excellent. I can't recommend it enough.

The tartufo cheese salad needed more flavor. It would have been elevated by use of some truffle oil or some other vinaigrette. Service was okay.  It was our anniversary but the restaurant didn't do anything. We were not looking for a free dessert but some gesture would have been nice given that we chose this restaurant to celebrate our special day. We also saw that other tables got cookies with their check which our server forgot for us.  The pasta are well cooked and tasty. Though I would have liked a little bit more kick in the gochujung pasta.

Fantastic wine pairings. The sort of simple, wholesome, uplifting fare that takes enormous amounts of work (compare L’Arpege in Paris), combined with more traditionally arty offerings (not 11 Madison Park, but in that genre). Good prices, lovely staff, wonderful decor and setting.
All good dishes but best to go for the unusual items - octopus for example is really good.
Fancy cocktails and nice Food
Excellent cocktails and recommendations from the staff
Excellent service,, their iconic dishes were excellent, and some misses on other pasta and entree.
Good food and service. Octopus cooked very well
It's so savory. I will be back with my friends. It has a nice interior.
Very tasty. Certainly worth a return trip.
Nice place to meet and catch up with family. Staff treated us so nice. Atmosphere is like a restaurant in Fort Worth I loved.
Excellent service and Great Atmosphere
Absolutely love the food, service, and interior. We celebrated our anniversary here and we'll be back for future special occasions for sure!

I was there tonight for a great meal. I love the look and vibe of Panny's. I had the pork with the arugula absolutely delicious. The only issue I found is a need for sound abatement. As the night goes on it get very loud. I'm still giving the place 5 stars but the experience would be better if it was quieter.
Great pasta and drinks!

Pammy’s... why it took us so long to come here?!! That were our first and last thoughts when we tasted the dishes. Every dish we tried was fresh and delicious. I love the ingredients they used. My bf’s cocktail was very good. I should have noted the name of the dishes we tried but I was too busy tasting them! Their salad looks simple but my first bite on that greens with shaved mushroom and truffle dressing turned out to be surprisingly YUMMY! Next, fried soft-shell crab with avocado and cucumber side vinaigrette dressing. DELISH! Soft shell crab is in season now. Thus, get it while it still last! We ordered skate wing for entree and it was perfectly cooked. Skate wing has a kind of texture similar to crab and I love crabs!!! There are so many dishes on the menu we wanted to try. I’m sure we will be back more often this summer!
Delicious,  interesting cuisine and lovely ambiance.
Food and service was AMAZING  ! Table and chair could be more comfy.  I definitely come back more often  !

The food is sublime, the drinks are innovative, and the service is impeccable. This is one of the best restaurants in Boston/Cambridge. I always look forward to eating here... but whenever I do, I'm reminded of the dreadful acoustics inside. The tables are marble. One wall is all glass. The ceiling is bare. There are many tiled surfaces. There is zero acoustic treatment inside, and almost no soft material. Therefore, ALL OF THE PATRONS ARE YELLING AT THEIR DINING COMPANIONS TO BE HEARD. Seriously, after a two-hour meal, your voice will be hoarse and your ears will be fatigued, because you have to speak very loudly to be heard by the person next to you. If you value your vocal cords and ears, wear earplugs and minimize your conversation.
Cool place, great food and superb service. We had the octopus, the soft shell crab, the hiramasa crudo, the skate and the bread pudding. Everything was great.

One of the best dinner restaurants in Cambridge. They grind their own flour for their amazing pasta. Typically I order apps and pasta. This last time I had the rib eye and it was one of the best streaks I've had in Boston. I recommend Pammy's for any occasion.
The new gold standard for inventive American cuisine

Super mediocre, especially for the price. Been wanting to try this place since it opened across the street from my apartment building, and my coworker gave a rave review.  We couldn't make a reservation, so we walked in at 5:30 and sat at the bar. The service was very friendly and accommodating, but slow.  Food was average. I had the market crudo and salad, and my friends both had the rabbit pasta. It was literally just regular pasta, and super greasy too.  The decor reminds me of public bathroom, with the huge white tiles.  Stay away.
My favorite Italian Restaurant in Boston at the moment, though I do sometimes wish they had larger tables in the bar area so I could order more food!

This happening restaurant in Cambridge has a very creative cuisine, great flavor and value. Very busy spot, the wait even with reservations might happen. The room is vibrat, and sometimes too loud to carry a conversation with friends. Drink orders usually takes a while to deliver. Appetizers are all good, mussels are amazing, seasonal octopus is quite tasty, etc There is variety for all: From pasta, to fish to pork. Staff and service are very friendly

Rare combination of warm & welcoming with delicious cuisine  We ate here for the first time -- but it won't be our last. From the friendly greeting at the door to first class service, the people who work at Pammy's are knowledgeable, friendly, and efficient.  Excellent call cocktails, wonderful wine list, and a kind of modern Italian meets artisinal local without becoming too "precious" - along with generous portions.  I remember the location back to before it was a Bel Canto's, and then an Indian restaurant. The interior is remarkably transformed and perfectly complements the food and service.  Pricey, but worth it!
Super cute spot to your for a date! Excellent customer service, I had a delicious appero spritz
Wife and I sat in the lounge, food and service is outstanding. From the drinks to desert and everything in between they do it all out of the park. Will be back again

This place lives up to its numerous accolades. If you're in the Boston area, you must eat at Pammy's ASAP. The food is unique and delicious, paired with a charming yet chic atmosphere to make it the perfect spot for a date or a small group dinner. Highly recommend the raw brussels, tuna tartare and bucatini. Their cocktails are also excellent, and they have an extensive wine list. I was lucky enough to walk into Pammy's with a friend around 7:30 pm on a Tuesday and get seated right away, but for anyone else thinking of going here, definitely make a reservation!
Amazing dinner and very attentive staff!

We were the first patrons to arrive and upon entering, I felt like I was welcomed and the atmosphere was perfect. The food was some of the best I’ve had and the grappa they recommended was the best I’ve ever had. Thanks for such a great time!!

We visited on a recent Saturday night and had a reservation for a party of 4 which quickly grew to a party of 6 when my daughter's friends wanted to join us. The hostess was more than willing to accommodate our larger party and we were pleased with the comfortable booth that allowed everyone to converse.We tried a variety of pasta and fish dishes, all of which were quite tasty. The service was great and we had a very enjoyable evening!

For modern Italian fare, not impressed by their pastas especially for that price point. Pasta didn’t taste freshly made as I would have hoped. Appetizers are priced closely to mains and pastas. Sitting at the booths is less than ideal because of leg room and being cramped. If anything I’d come here to catch a drink to get a “Brooklyn-Esque” feel in Cambridge.
Decent Italian place this side of the Charles River (i.e. Cambridge side).
Exceptional service and terrific food. I had Lumache Bolognese and it was outstanding.

Phil and I thought booked two seats at the counter and were pleasantly surprised to find out that infant it was not two seats at the bar, instead it was two seats at a large communal table in the center of the room. Apparently open table does not provide the restaurant with an accurate way to describe the seating. We were luck enough to sit at two seats on the corner of the table. It allowed for privacy and was perfect for us. We enjoyed our dinner. It is a very inventive menu. Many textures in the dishes we had. Loved he brussel sprouts salad. Very citrusy and tasty. The beet covered american unagi was nothing like a japanese unagi. The skate was delicious and the shrimp pasta was yummy. The room is welcoming, warm, loud and comfortable. Service by Nick was top notch. First visit...will not be our last. It is easier to get reservations for 2 guests since that is all they seat at the communal table. I have tried for months to get in for 4 guests. They just don't have much seating for that number
I'd give Pammy's 6 stars! An outstanding dining experience in every respect. Just go. You won't regret it.
Modern Italian restaurant with a rotating menu. Excellent service and food. The charcuterie board is to die for.
Pammy's is one of those "if you haven't been there, you need to go" kind of places. I've been lucky enough to snag a reservation there a few times and each meal was better than the last.
One of the best
One of the best pasta ever had, great food, great drinks
Delicious as always

My favorite (contemporary) Italian in Boston area.  Top notch food, service and atmosphere. Great menu that is small enough to digest but has enough options that you can’t wait to come back.  Food: Presentation is beautiful but not at the sacrifice of flavor or texture. Every dish has an unexpected twist. Order the bruschetta - they serve it upside down with a piece of house made garlic rub rustic bread on a bed of dice tomatoes and mozzarella.  Drink: Interesting, funky wine list that carries classics as well as the unexpected, off the beaten path wines that you find yourself hunting for the next day. Wouldn’t consider the restaurant a mixology destination but solid bar tending game.  Service: Staff is knowledgeable, professional and friendly. Team service environment. Expert on the menu and happy to engage over the food.
Beautiful and delicious. A special treat.
Delicious food, and even more delicious cocktails. Get the Branzino and the sweetbreads.  Excellent service all around.

We got a reservation for two on a Friday night, we were supposed to sit at the bar but they managed to give us a table anyway. The only negative was that we had to stand in the middle of the restaurant while waiting  , but it was only a few-minute wait and it was totally worth it. We got antipasti della casa (get it, it’s just amazing) and 2 pastas that were both excellent. There wasn’t much choice for dessert so we didn’t get any, but we were totally satisfied anyway. Total price was around 100. We really loved this place!
The menu  at Pammy's changes frequently, but if you find Brussels sprout salad with pickled eggs on it, start there.
Pasta to die for.

One of the best restaurants in Cambridge/Boston right now. The drink and beer selection is terrific (negronis on tap!), food is always on point - highly recommend the charcuterie, octopus and rabbit - and finally their desserts and digestifs are just the right size and combination. Prices are super reasonable for the quality, and above all else they have unbelievable service! Truly amazing!
Awesome service and awesome food. A must go :)

Such a welcoming and warm little restaurant! From the hostess who greeted me, making me feel so happy that I stopped in on this cold evening, to the bartender who payed just the right amount of attention. And not to forget, the Casarecce pasta was absolutely one of the best dishes I’ve had in a very long time. The next time I’m in Boston I’ll look forward to going back!
So glad I found Pammy's!!  Super cute venue, owners and staff who genuinely care, and a small but well-crafted menu that is superb. Can't wait to go back soon!

Exceptional service and good quality. The bruschetta was mouth-watering, and the Bolognese was rich. My wife and I split several plates and had a few cocktails each. It was a splurge, but a worthy one.
Delicious food in a great environment. Perfect for a romantic dinner. Will definitely go back.
If you want to know what yummy feels like, come here
Excellent food. A little on the salty side but excellent nonetheless. Portions can seem a little small but the food is very filling and satisfying.
The lumache is hands down the best pasta you will find in Boston. Everything else is great too, but the lumache is a must-order.

End to end, one of the best meals and restaurant experiences I've ever had in Boston. Walked up without reservations on a Monday night, the hostess was very accommodating and got us seated in 15 minutes. Props for recommending the negronis on tap, which turned out to be some of the best I've ever had.  We skipped starters and went straight to the pasta and mains. We ordered the lumache in bolognese and gochujang - it was perfectly al dente, and the sauce combination was the right blend to give the dish a twist. The highlight of the night was the perfectly seared duck with fried rice and Tuscan kale. Not always a fan of duck, but this dish is a phenomenal exceptiin. Will be back here next time I'm in Boston.
Great interior and wine list but...not vegetarian friendly, which is unusual for Italian (the one entree we could order vegetarian was a pasta they normally use a fish sauce in).
Great food, great bartenders.  What is not to like?
An amazing dining experience. Make a reservation way in advance!
This place is too noisy. Food is good but not good enough for the ambience. This place does not deserve the buzz it is getting!

Everything we ate was awesome and the staff treated us as if it were fine dining. Can't speak highly enough of Pammy's. Definitely a must try! If they have their special bruschetta with veal. Get it, just get it. Also, the pork Milanese is something I will dream about.
Unique, finely prepared dishes and the same goes for the cocktails.  Plus it's the only place I know of in the US that does an Aperitivo hour on the weekends

(Translated by Google) I tried a delicious pasta a little spicy for a species, I loved it a lot. Also, if wine and wine is a good and varied, perfect combination for a night of friends or a dinner to pamper yourself.  (Original) Probé una rica pasta un poco picante por una especie, me encantó mucho. Además, si carta e vinos es un buena y variada, perfecta combinación para una noche de amigos o una cena para consentirte.
The drinks were amazing ..the food was amazing...the decor was amazing. You must go and experience Pammy's.
If you can get a reservations you must. Great place for drinks and food

A great place with great atmosphere and warm welcoming feel. I was alone and sat at the bar and had the Lumache pasta plate which was just perfect. Keep in mind they have a twist on traditional plates so don’t be surprised. It is not so much that it is unrelated to original dish however enough to want you to come back.  My only hesitation for my next visit is that I would avoid the bar as the bar woman gave me absolutely no attention and it was a struggle to get her attention.  Luckily the GM Lauren was fantastic and seeing my plight came over explained the dishes and took my order and more than made up for the slip up.  That said when it came to desert I decided to skip and as I was not enjoying the experience at the bar.  I will go back because I liked everything else about the place the decor, atmosphere and most importantly the food.
This place was very good! We had the bolognese with gochujang and my friend had the fish!!!  But the best part was the dessert! Blueberry clafoutis with marscapone ice cream. Like WUHT?? So good.
Delicious!!!
Maybe the best pasta in the Boston metro?  I'm not sure if that's too bold a statement.  This place is amazing, and they have negronis on tap.
Nice customer service food was great wife's favorite place!
Good food. Crowded noisy space (how much would a few sound panels cost?). Expensive.
Get the Negroni and then eat everything!!
Lovely ambience in a warm and stylish environment. Excellent service too. Food would be amazing if it wasn't for too heavy a hand with salt. Like this place very much

Food was excellent but service a little slow.(Hate it when the cocktail and app arrive at the same time.) For entertainment, fire alarms were set off by smoke from dozens of tea lights in use. Nobody evacuated, servers expertly extinguished and picked up the tea lights and firefighters were ushered into the kitchen. For snacks? Unusual, but would certainly return for the food.
Exceptional food and service its the  best in Boston right now.
Friendly staff, knowledgeable waiters, great atmosphere and amazing food!  Recommendations: Lumache, Spaghetti and Malfadine
Every bite of our meal revealed a hidden flavor, a treat cut short by my fast fork that couldn’t contain the excitement.
Fab place, terrific wait staff, great cocktails. And, oh yes, fab food. Everything to perfection.
Great drinks, food and ambiance. Worth the price.
Excellent food and lovely service
Nice room. OK, pricey food. I wouldn't go back.

I had a great experience at Pammy’s. The staff was welcoming and kind, the ambiance was relaxed yet refined (just like the food!). Most of the food I had was delicious. As appetizers, we got the mixed greens and garlic toast with heirloom tomatoes. Both were excellent and scrumptious. As a main course, I got the spaghetti 2.3. The pasta itself was perfectly cooked and beautifully homemade. However, I found the sauce too sweet for my liking— less like tomato sauce and more like sweet pepper sauce. For dessert, we had the blueberry crostata. I wished there was more blueberry filling and less crust, but it was still very tasty (not as exceptional as the other food, however). Overall, I greatly enjoyed my experience at Pammy’s and would definitely recommend it to others.
Eeeeeverything is awesome when you're part of a teaam
Wow. Fresh, delicious Italian. Friendly wait staff and gorgeous interior. Two servers had chosen a night off to come and experience the food again themselves!
Delicious meal in a vibrant yet cozy environment.  Great service and especially nice to have Pam the owner chat to us on a busy Saturday night.
Delicious spicy bruschetta, spaghetti 2.3 and bolognese were simple but full of umami

We went to Pammy's with our son and daughter in law.  Having never been to Boston it was their recommendation.  We are foodies and the food and drinks were the best we have had in years.  My daughter in law was delighted to hear that.  The best dish was the braised rabbit, but each dish was perfection.  I hope that we get to visit again soon.
Spaghetti 2.3 was incredible. Top 3 best red sauce I've had. Great to know I don't need to go all the way to the North End for good Italian anymore!
Everything we ordered was excellent, as was the service. Went to celebrate a special occasion and we were happy as were the diners at adjacent tables. (Tables are too closely spaced.)
Great bar. Tasty, well-crafted food. Friendly staff. Love their apperative hour.

Came for the first Apertivo Hour (4:30-5:30) of the summer in 2018. Their cocktails we're creative and really tasty. We ordered the cheese board which was really good, especially for the price, I highly suggest trying it if cheese and bread is your thing. Would definitely come for dinner the next time I'm in the area.
Love this place. Very creative and delicious dinner plates. Amazing cocktails and helpful waitstaff. Top 5 restaurant in Boston for me

Seriously stellar. The meal we had here blew our minds wide open. The rabbit pasta....ooooooooooie! Drinks, environment, service, food, this place ticks all the boxes. If you've been thinking about it, wait no longer and just go. You have to spend time in the space to really get it. Cheers!
Nice vibe.
Outstanding food
(Translated by Google) Very good  (Original) Muito bom

If you want Italian in Boston - forget the North End and come to Pammy’s. The food is excellent (you must try the Malfadine pasta), the drinks are delicious (they have an aperitivo menu complete with draft negronis), and the desserts are incredible (frozen yogurt with rhubarb granita- want this dish all summer long). The service was fantastic and made me think about the last time I had a meal feel so complete. Pammy’s checks all the boxes and more.

Great cocktails, wine selection, and food. Not many new age Italian restaurants in Boston I can think of. Decor makes me feel like I stepped into a romantic Italian garden party. I’d eat and drink here forever if my wallet and waistline could afford it.

Fantastic opening spritz cocktail before we had our appetizers (mussels and a piadina, the piadina was extraordinarily good). We progressed to a couple of different cocktails (me the bitter yet balanced fernet-based cocktail "fernettaboutit" and her a classic negroni) before our primi.  The primo was an excellent spaghetti dish - the tomato flavors were mature and burst beautifully in your mouth alongside the fresh and perfectly al sentence pasta. For secondi, I had the chicken al mattone and she had the braised short rib. The chicken comes with a crispy skin, and a beautiful double reduced broth with the richness cut by the bitter and crispy endive. Just a splendid dish I'd go back for by itself. Her short rib was perfectly cooked and the jus went excellently with the polenta - rich, but not overwhelmingly so.  We accompanied the primi with a beautiful natural sparkling wine, the name of which I now forget, which had been recommended by the barman (Josh) who is incredibly knowledgeable and he made great pairing suggestions. A fantastic, memorable experience and we'd love to go back.  Pic is of the piadina. She took some others, but I forgot to grab the pics.
Food, service, and atmosphere were perfection!
Very nice place I love their food and drinks Very friendly environment I definitely recommend.
Great food and service
Its a pretty space, but there's nothing extraordinary about the food...

This place is great for Italian food! Don't go here for pizza though - I am actually not sure if they have any. But their pasta/ricotta/everything else is top class. The prices are on the higher end and the portions on the smaller end but it's well worth the cost for a good dinners/date. The ambience of the place is amazing for a dinner with your friends/loved ones
Great ambiance, excellent food and outstanding service.

My wife and I sat at the bar and the friendly bartender poured me an Old Fashioned that was perfect, and I tasted my wife's Pepe di Rosa, which was flavorful and unlike anything else I've had. We drooled over the Black Bass, Maldafin Duck, and muscles. Pam herself helped me select my first glass of wine and Lauren the sommelier helped me select the second. Wonderful picks both.  I can't get enough of the ambience, the staff that treat us like family, and of course the cocktails and cuisine.

Love this place. The ambience is friendly and intimate. It manages to be a local neighbourhood gem *and* a cosy first date bar. The food is ridiculously good (Spaghetti 2.3 ftw) and the bartenders (pictured) work tirelessly to make extraordinarily balanced beverages. You're all encouraged to come here, as long as you save a seat for me at the bar ;)

Pammy's is a great neighborhood restaurant, and it is totally worth the trip, even if you live outside Cambridge. The space is fun, the bar area gets busy, the service is great and the food is outstanding. It is a popular place, so I definitely recommend to make a reservation in advance. As far as the food and the drinks go - everything was on point. The cooking influence is Italian, but with a modern approach. Flavors are complex, the food is not overly heavy. This is most definitely not your chicken parm or spaghetti and meatballs place (there are enough of those already). We tried the Malfaldine and the Capalletti pastas (fresh made) and both were outstanding. If you have been to Giulia, expect this level of pasta preparation. The mushroom bruschetta was fantastic - super comforting and delicious. The Wagyu short rib steak was tender, juicy and delicious. Desserts were excellent as well. All in all - a great meal and the overall value (including prices, food, drinks, service, ambiance) is very high. Can't wait for the next time.
Interesting waiter...

Really exceptional food. We had the scallop/uni/citrus/pistachio crudo 😍😍😍, muscles with squid ink aroncini, black bass, and some of the best short rib I've ever had, and it was all delectable. Highly recommend.
Good pasta new york style yet corporate vibe
Some of the best Italian I had in years. The place is quite packed and loud, but the food is to die for.
Must get pork chop, veal bruschetta.
This is a great neighborhood restaurant. Food is well prepared from a small menu. Good variety of drinks.
Wonderful food (mushroom app is amazing) and attentive service. Very popular, so a reservation is a must.
OMG  my new favorite  a must
One of the best ambiances of any restaurant in the Cambridge/Boston area. Excellent food and service matches the quality to create a truly special spot.

This is a gorgeous palazzo/brasserie space highlighted by a Janus-like white-tile fireplace; a communal-style, wooden Pennsylvania college drafting table with a central Carrara marble inlay; a baroque mirror worthy of Versailles; a Carrara marble bar facing a lovely uplight female sculptural element from Harlem's Demolition Depot; and a beautiful WC wall-hanging that might charm even Mr. Rorschach.  The highlight of our first dinner here was a delicious, soft-as-butter, very well-marinated Wagyu Short Rib Steak ($32) with polenta, heirloom carrots, and tamarind honey. The Lumache (house made, shell-shaped) bolognese ($24) with Gochujang (Korean red chilli paste) was pretty good but, contrary to the opinion of a local heat-seeking-missile food critic, aka Devra First, did not "steadily a reveal a gentle heat." That heat was there from the beginning and, to this eater, quite intense and too dominant. So, also contrary to Ms. First, the dish was lacking in the "harmonious" touch she found at Pammy's, and which I feel is indicative of cooking mastery.  If I were using Gochujang, I would add something like béchamel to help create that balance.  Our desserts included an excellent, multi-textural Cocoa Nib Cake ($11) with a caramel budino; and an apple Crostata ($11) with creme fraiche ice cream that was pretty good, and nicely buttery, but was almost ruined by too-crisp apples.  A polished Negroni was well-balanced, and a Sicilian Nero D'Avola paired well with the Lumache and steak.  Flour is house-milled at Pammy's, and the pasta and bread were all the better for it.  BTW, on a minor note, although we had indicated that this was a special birthday celebration in our Open Table reservation, no acknowledgement was made by staff.  A 2% kitchen administration fee is added to the bill, a good mark for fairness.
Great ambiance and food.  Love the Negroni on tap!
Pestex is a company made up of team people who happily work as a team to solve pest problem

By far my favourite restaurant in Boston to date. Great decor, excellent vibe, wonderful food and delicious wine list. The staff were terrific and knowledgeable which made for a great night.  Definitely going to be back for more.
Great food, great cocktails, great atmosphere.
Delicious
a treat yourself establishment. Good vibe. Interesting menu. Good date night spot.
Fantastic food and service
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Ótimo
Delicious food served by a friendly, knowledgeable staff
Very tasty
Fantastic food and selections.  Notice there are two bruchetta appetizers.  Why?  Because they are delicious.  Reccomend the octopus as a main if you are not too hungry.
Incredible meal.  Everything was delicious, but the octopus was outstanding.
Loved the mushroom bruscetta. Pasta dishes were unique but very tasty. Never would have thought gochujang (Korean red pepper paste) would go well in Italian food.
Great service and nice drinks, pasta is possibly a bit too al dente.
Amazing Arctic char
Fantastic cocktails and delicious, inventive food in a cozy setting.

Wonderful atmosphere, fun and vibrant place with excellent staff, everyone attentive, welcoming and accommodating. We enjoyed our starters and pasta dishes along with a made to order crostata that was to die for.... however the main dishes were disastrous., steak without any seasoning, fregola sarda extremely chewy, awful texture combinations... needs a lot of improvement.. a starter/pasta/dessert is more than enough food. I will go back and avoid the main dishes. It's a great new hang out place in Harvard Square.
Cool vibe, but drinks are expensive and meant for more high income folks. Cocktails are very unique, non adventurous palettes may want to order their own bar drink. Beer selection small but good.
Great food, wonderful staff, awesome ambience.
Cozy atmosphere and delicious drinks.   Can't wait to try the food.
The drinks and decor are amazing. Will come back to try the food.
Pasta was simply excellent! A must try.
Will be back! So delicious!

Really fun place! Intimate, but not cramped, very attentive staff, befitting of a restaurant that is still working (and working hard!) to establish their reputation. They were fairly full on a Monday night, so it seems to be working.  I heard great things so I came in, and the service and cocktails and food were really great. The pasta with broccoli rabe and the poached yolk was such a lovely mix of warm and comforting and tangy and flavorful from the broccoli and whatever the sauce was. My cocktail (the fantasma negroni) was undoubtedly a negroni but very different from your normal negroni, which Pammy's has on tap! A super cool little detail that I would be excited to try on a second visit, which I will inevitably be making. I also appreciate their location, a little bit out off the main drag of central square restaurants, but equally if not more deserving of a spot among those bigger and older names. A wonderful experience, can't wait to experience it again.
We had a fantastic meal here. Food was great. The service was great. The drinks were great. Definitely will be coming back,.
Tasty food and the portions weren't too precious. Drinks were great as well.
Outstanding. Must try the octopus. Dont skip desert.

I came here on opening night.  The food was superb. We didn't get to try anything from the bar, so I cannot attest to their cocktails. We had the braised octopus, fusulli lunghi and lumache.  Everything was great, including the clean bathrooms.
Great cognac watermelon cocktial

One of the best meals I've had all year. Farm fresh ingredients the key to the amazing quality of our entire meal. The service was excellent and the attention to detail was obvious.  This chef has talent.

It has been open for a little more than a month, and I've already been 4 times. The dishes and drinks are just the tip of the iceberg to Pammy's gastronomic charm. The staff is lovely and make it my new go to place in the neighborhood.
cozy, delicious and wonderful staff!
Really strong addition to the Boston culinary scene.
Refreshing, original decor. Warm, personalized service with knowledgeable wine director.  The food was outstanding.

Very happy this place exists, been here twice and can't wait to come back. The decor is immaculate, the staff are sharp, quick, and helpful. The cuisine is incredible: melt-in-your mouth bread made with freshly house-milled flour, octopus so tender you won't recognize it as a cephalopod, and an amazing ricotta angnolotti set with a perfect balance of mushrooms and herbs. Desserts were equally impressive.  Don't come here expecting heaping platefuls of food, this is quality over quantity. Portions are not large, but aren't as small as some have been saying. Supplemented with the unbelievably delicious house bread, 2 people can happily fill up even splitting 2 apps and 1 entree. I think the "$$" price category has been throwing off some folks; this is should probably be in the "$$$" price category.

We had an excellent meal and experience at this great new addition to the Cambridge food scene. It was a busy Friday night. Two of us ate at the bar. Our server, Jen, was terrific. Busy as hell all evening she managed to remember names and kept a running, relaxed conversation throughout. We let her choose wines for us and she did not disappoint. Really good , interesting, and different wines by the glass.  The food was fabulous. We started with the octopus and artichokes hearts with boquerones. Both were delicious! Based on a review here claiming small pasta portions we ordered two. the fusili with clams and the agnolottti with mushrooms. Both portions were substantial and delicious! It is true that there are ten pieces in the agnolotti dish but it's stuffed pasta for goodness sake! How many ravioli does one get in a normal serving? There were many many more than ten noodles in the fusili dish.  Unfortunately we had no room for dessert. We left full, satisfied, and with smiles on our faces. The excellent meal with three glasses of wine each cost $120 including a 25% tip. Excellent value for such a good meal.  We will be back!  Go to Pammy's before reservations are hard to come by!

Let me start by saying I have been looking forward to going to this restaurant for a long time, as I live in the neighborhood and anxiously peered into the window while walking by over the past few months. When my girlfriend and I found out that it had finally announced a soft opening, we were in! Without knowing anything about the menu, we had no idea what to expect during our experience.  The atmosphere in the bar/dining area is great. The brown leather, frosted glass globe sconces, and gold accents give off a cool, 1920's vibe that works for a great date spot or a classy place to meet up with friends.  After sitting down at a stylish, rounded booth table, we decided to go with glasses of wine. I went with a regional glass of white from Maine, and it was fantastic. Who knew Maine was a wine hotspot? We then proceeded to order 2 appetizers. The Heirloom tomatoes and the octopus. Both were absolutely perfect! I've seriously never had octopus that was cooked that well. Literally melt in your mouth texture. The tomato dish (paired with a piece of garlic bread) was certainly memorable as well. After ordering 2 appetizers, we took a look at the menu and decided that we would both be full after splitting a pasta dish, after all it was $26 and we would be getting desserts to top everything off. The pasta arrived (super fast might I add, service was fantastic) and my girlfriend and I took a look at it and wondered where the rest of it went. Seriously there were 10 noodles (we know because we each had 5 and could count them on one hand). The pasta was great, but it left us both hungry and we had already spent $80.  To finish the meal off, we were going to order a dessert, but they were $11 each and also not filling (judging by the items ordered at the table next to us), so we decided to call it a night and grab some dessert at a great bakery down the street.  Atmosphere 5/5 Service 5/5 Food 4/5 Value 1/5  Overall, it pains me to say that we will not be going back anytime soon unless they decide to increase their portion sizes or lower their price point. It's hard to leave feeling satisfied after spending $100, and think about grabbing takeout Chinese from the place next door to satisfy your rumbling stomach. If you are celebrating a special occasion and don't mind spending $60 per guest, then I would highly recommend this. Otherwise, I would recommend Waypoint (right down the street) or Giulia (make a reservation 3 weeks in advance) for a better value.

Can't wait to dine here again - and again - and again! The owners spared no expense in designing the space - it is beautiful! Chef Willis aced the flavors with each and every dish that we tried. Service was impeccable and the wine list was expertly curated (I loved their selection of naturally fermented wines). An A++ for this Cambridge neighborhood.
